page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: ROCKHAMPTON,the village that lies in the centre of the D block is situated about 3 kilometres to the NNE of Thornbury in the County of Avon. The parish lies on the Avon/Gloucestershire border. It is a sparsely populated area in Avon,the number of people living there being about 150. The area is predominantly agricultural with the majority of farmers concentrating on beef,mutton and dairy produce. Most of the land is used for grazing. Only a few minor roads cross the area but the main A38 Trunk road cuts the SE corner of the block. Two Government establishments have been placed to the east. They are the HM Detention Centre for young offenders and The Hospital Estate Management and Engineering Centre at Eastwood Park.
